chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason P Glidden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second or Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(3)(a).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action including repayment of the buy money.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with co-defendant(s).
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions of probation apply to all counts.
Consecutive to: Ct. 1

records.addlTxt: Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order - ERP
Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order - ERP
Letters from DAI staff to Court regarding completion of Substance Abuse Program.

of Conviction and Order - ERP.    IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days will be determined by DOC Records office staff and will be based upon actual release date.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.    (Order mailed to Drug Abuse Correctional Center 4/20/20.  Also sent through DOC interface)

records.addlTxt: for DNA Sample

Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Cts. 1 - 5.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 - 5.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. Court orders PSI. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Jason P Glidden in court with attorney Raj Kumar Singh.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Defendant ready to conclude the matter today.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Defense Discovery Demand
State's Discovery Demand

Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover. State will file the Information and Discovery demand later today. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Jason P Glidden in court with attorney Raj Kumar Singh.  Defendant Jason P Glidden in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.   Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, indicates defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing today.  Arraignment scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
